Investing in Real Estate

  1. Dashboard
  2. Select Option

Welcome! Here you will find information on how to get started in Real Estate while in college.

There are about as many ways to invest in real estate as there are properties to invest in.

The most common way is to purchase rental properties. These can be single or multi-family homes, where you as the owner would put money down to purchase the property in your name. Then you would rent out the space to cover your mortage, maintenance, and other expenses, and have little bit extra on top. Below is an that breaks down the pros and cons of single and multi-family investements.

As mentioned before, there are many ways to get started in real estate. While most require that you have a substatial amount of starting capital, there are other strategies that do not. Here we give a brief description of each one, and point you in a direction where you can learn more.

REITs (Real Estate Investment Trusts)

REITs are a great way to get started in real estate without having to deal with actual property. Essentially you are investing in a company's stock in various commercial real estate properties, such as office buildings, retail spaces, apartments and hotels. They can be risky depending on whether the REIT is publicly or privately traded. New investors should stick with publicly traded, since its more likely that they will be liquidable. Check out this site to learn more: https://www.reit.com/

Short Term Rentals (STR)

With the growth of companies like AirBnB, STRs have become a popular alternative for tenants and owners. STRs tend to yield much higher returns than longer term rentals. However, the expenses associated with STRs can quickly add up. Another important consideration is the location of your prospective STR. Is there a near by attraction that guarantees that people are frequently visiting that area? Check out this article to learn more:

Wholesaling

Wholesaling can be a risky but lucrative path to Real Estate investement, all while never owning a property. Essentially, a wholesaler is a middleman between the buyer and seller of a property. The wholesaler would contract with a seller to buy the house. Then they would go in search of a buyer, pitching a price that is higher than what the seller is selling for. The wholesale would arrange the transaction, then keep the difference as profit. To learn more about this sector, check out the article

Mobile Homes

Surprisingly, there are some big gains to be made by investing in mobile homes. To learn more about this hidden sector, check out the article below.
